Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with turn to neck; interior streakily glazed black; exterior, from top: black on neck; chequer border of panel at top of shoulder; traces of two vertical black framing bands on left and black figure decoration consisting of komos scene (hair and shoulder of male figure with added red on chest), dancing to right; ancient repair hole.
Producer name: Manner/Style of: The KY Painter (Komast Group)
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.599.a, 1888,0601.599.b and 1888,0601.599.c.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 256, no. 12)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 261, no. B182)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 15b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0119) (Phase 1)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 123) (Naukratis 100)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
